agent

Class StringUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • agent.StringUtil

  • public class StringUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a class to contain generic string utilities
    Version:
    0.0
    Author:
    Thomas S. Robertson

      • breakAt

        public static java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> breakAt(java.lang.String s,
                                         char sep,
                                         int maxItems,
                                         boolean discardEmptyStrings,
                                         boolean trimEachString)
        Break a string at a separator char, returning a vector of at most maxItems strings.
        Parameters:
        discardEmptyStrings - if true, empty strings (caused by delimiters at the start or end of the string, or adjacent delimiters) will not be included in the result.
        trimEachString - is true, each string in the result will be trim()ed

      • breakAt

        public static java.util.Vector breakAt(java.lang.String s,
                       char sep,
                       int maxItems,
                       boolean discardEmptyStrings)
        Break a string at a separator char, returning a vector of at most maxItems strings.
        Parameters:
        discardEmptyStrings - if true, empty strings (caused by delimiters at the start or end of the string, or adjacent delimiters) will not be included in the result.

      • breakAt

        public static java.util.Vector breakAt(java.lang.String s,
                       char sep)
        Break a string at a separator char, returning a vector of strings. Include any empty strings in the result.

      • breakAt

        public static java.util.Vector breakAt(java.lang.String s,
                       char sep,
                       int maxItems)
        Break a string at a separator char, returning a vector of at most maxItems strings. Include any empty strings in the result.

        Parameters:
        str - String to trim
        chars - String containing the chars to trim after
        Returns:

      • countOccurences

        public static int countOccurences(java.lang.String str,
                  java.lang.String subStr)
        Returns the number of instances of a particular substring in a string. This ignores overlap, starting from the left, so 'xxxxxy' would have 2 instances of 'xx', not 4. Empty string as a substring returns 0.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • gensym

        public static java.lang.String gensym(java.lang.String base)
        Generate a unique string.
        Parameters:
        base - the initial substring
        Returns:
        a string consisting of the supplied initial substring and a unique counter value.

      • trimHostName

        public static java.lang.String trimHostName(java.lang.String hostname)
        Trim a hostname, removing "www." from the front, if present, and the TLD from the end. If this would result in an empty string, the entire name is returned.
        Parameters:
        a - hostname
        Returns:
        the trimmed hostname

      • parseTimeInterval

        public static long parseTimeInterval(java.lang.String str)
        Parse a string as a time interval. An interval is specified as an integer with an optional suffix. No suffix means milliseconds, s, m, h, d, w indicates seconds, minutes, hours, days and weeks respectively.
        Parameters:
        the - interval
        Returns:
        interval in milliseconds

      • trimBlankLines

        public static java.lang.String trimBlankLines(java.lang.String txt)
        Trim leading and trailing blank lines from a block of text

      • timeIntervalToString

        public static java.lang.String timeIntervalToString(long millis)
        Generate a string representing the time interval.
        Parameters:
        millis - the time interval in milliseconds
        Returns:
        a string in the form dDhHmMsS

      • trimStackTrace

        public static java.lang.String trimStackTrace(java.lang.String msg,
                              java.lang.String trace)
        Remove the first line of the stack trace, iff it duplicates the end of the exception message
